item.title: Disable gpg GUI asking for paraphrase
item.description: Someone suggested that if you have seahorse installed, remove it. (I did, but it did not work) Someone suggested that exporting PINENTRY_USER_DATA=“USE_CURSES=1” will do the trick. It also did not work. **Add --no-use-agent to the command option. It worked with old version of gpg. No gui is appeared while decrypting the file. This does not work with gpg2. Program gpg2 needs a use-agent. You have to create a file ~/.
